abstract: Bank of America’s chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, said Wednesday that he expected more mergers among American banks as the economy stabilizes, but that his bank would not be looking for further acquisitions.
snippet: Bank of America’s chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, said Wednesday that he expected more mergers among American banks as the economy stabilizes, but that his bank would not be looking for further acquisitions.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America‘s chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, said Wednesday that he expected more mergers among American banks as the economy stabilizes but that his bank would not be looking for further acquisitions.

headline.main: Lewis Says BofA Isn’t Looking for More Acquisitions
